DOC.brief_summary: RATIONALE : The amount dietary fat fiber may affect estrogen metabolism postmenopausal woman , may affect risk develop cancer . PURPOSE : Randomized dietary intervention study effectiveness low-fat diet combine either high fiber low fiber estrogen metabolism healthy postmenopausal woman .
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : I . Determine effect low fat diet combine either high fiber ( 25-35 gram per day ) low fiber ( 10-15 gram per day ) intake estrogen metabolism healthy postmenopausal woman . OUTLINE : This randomize study . Patients randomize one 2 arm ( dietary fat reduction without increased fiber ) . All patient must successfully complete dietary run-in phase 4 week randomization . During run-in phase , patient ask maintain food record day 7-14 . Patients undergo radioisotopic infusion study sex steroid metabolism day 14 , 21 , 28 . Patients give 3 prepackaged meal day 12 week . Patients must maintain record food eat return food container center documentation . Patients undergo radioisotopic infusion study sex steroid metabolism day 70 , 77 , 84 . At end 12 week , patient meet dietitian 30 minute receive instruction maintain low fat , high fiber diet second phase study . PROJECTED ACCRUAL : 40 woman accrue 4 year .
DOC.criteria: DISEASE CHARACTERISTICS : Healthy postmenopausal female age 50 69 diet great 32 % total calorie fat less 15 gram fiber PATIENT CHARACTERISTICS : Age : 50 69 Sex : Female Performance status : Not specify Life expectancy : Not specify Hematopoietic : Not specify Hepatic : Not specify Renal : Not specify Other : At least 2 year since menopause In general good health Increased body fat ( 125 % 175 % ideal body weight ) Increased upper body fat ( waisttohip circumference ratio great 0.85 ) Serum estradiol great 13 picograms per milliliter PRIOR CONCURRENT THERAPY : No concurrent medication interfere blood test result No hormone replacement therapy thyroid hormone
